comment.body: conversations looks nice. Signal encryption with xmpp
@Drymer: OMEMO is the signal encryption implementation for xmpp. According to their website
@Zorriko: Yea the axolotl protocol is the old name for the signal protocol, I think they changed the protocol name to signal just recently.
The 2 doesn't power a HDD, don't know about a hub.

What about the good old xmpp. you can use It on nearly every device and better encryption is under heavy development (Omemo).
See:
https://chatsecure.org/blog/chatsecure-v323-xmpp-push/

I run zeronet as user.
Download the Bundle and extract it in a folder of your choice in your home folder.

put:
>[Unit]
>Description=Zero net Start
>After=network.target
>
>[Service]
>ExecStart=/home/"path into the extracted folder"/ZeroNetnoBrowser.sh
>Restart=on-failure
>SuccessExitStatus=3 4
>RestartForceExitStatus=3 4
>
>[Install]
>WantedBy=default.target
>
into:
>~/.config/systemd/user/zeronet.service

you can run it with:
>systemctl --user start zeronet

This way I can use the auto update function without any permission problems.
